The Act titled "District of Columbia Pension Liability Funding Reform Act of 1994" increases and extends the federal contribution to District of Columbia pension funds. The District of Columbia Retirement Reform Act amends section 144(a) by adjusting the funding amounts for the pension fund from fiscal year 1995 to 2035. The District of Columbia Retirement Reform Act adjusts funding amounts for the pension fund from fiscal year 1995 to 2035, with increases of 5 percent annually. Amendments also involve updating references to years in various sections of the Act. TITLE II--CHANGES IN RETIREMENT BENEFITS

Subtitle A--Police Officers' and Fire Fighters' Contribution

SEC. 201. INCREASE IN CONTRIBUTION.

Amends the Policemen and Firemen's Retirement and Disability Act to increase the contribution percentage for members who are officers or members of the Metropolitan Police force or the Fire Department of the District of Columbia.

SEC. 202. ESTABLISHMENT OF SINGLE ANNUAL COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENT. Subsection (m) of the Policemen and Firemen's Retirement and Disability Act is amended to change the process for determining the annual cost-of-living adjustment for annuities. The Mayor will now calculate the percentage change in the price index for the preceding year to determine if there is a rise in the index. The annuity increase is based on the percentage change in the price index for the preceding year, with adjustments made to the nearest \1/10\ of 1 per centum. The Mayor determines the price index change for annuity increases, effective March 1, 1996. Annuities before September 1, 1995, increase by the change adjusted to the nearest \1/10\ of 1 per centum. Annuities after September 1, 1995, and before March 1, 1996, increase pro rata based on the change. The annuity increase is determined by the Mayor based on the price index change, effective March 1, 1996. The increase is adjusted to the nearest \1/10\ of 1 per centum for annuities before September 1, 1995. SEC. 203. Equalization of contribution rules for former retirees by amending Section 209(a)(2)(B) of the District of Columbia Retirement Reform Act. Repeal of relief allowance or compensation increase under Section 301 of the District of Columbia Police and Firemen's Salary Act of 1953. Increase in teachers' contribution to 8 per centum for pay periods starting on or after October 1, 1995. Establishment of a single annual cost-of-living adjustment. Section 21(b) of the Act for the retirement of public-school teachers in the District of Columbia is amended to adjust the determination of the price index annually by the Mayor. If there is a rise in the price index, contributions from teachers will increase. The price index for annuities with a commencing date on or before March 1 of the preceding year will be increased annually based on the percentage change, adjusted accordingly. Annuities with a commencing date after March 1 will receive a pro rata increase calculated based on the number of months the annuity was payable before the adjustment. On January 1, 1996, the Mayor will determine the price index change from December 1995 to June 1995. Annuities before September 1, 1995, will increase by the percentage change, while those after will receive a pro rata increase based on the months payable before the adjustment. The annuity increase is calculated by multiplying 1/6 of the percentage change by the number of months the annuity was payable before the effective date, up to 6 months, and adjusting to the nearest 1/10 of 1 percent. Subtitle C--Judges' Contribution

SEC. 221. INCREASE IN CONTRIBUTION.

    Amends section 11-1563(a) of D.C. Code to increase withholding to 4.5% for pay periods starting on or after October 1, 1995. 
    Amends section 11-1564(d)(1) of D.C. Code to adjust retirement salary contributions to 4.5% for services performed after October 1, 1995.

TITLE III--EFFECTIVE DATE

SEC. 301. EFFECTIVE DATE.

    The amendments take effect on October 1, 1995.
